intro: Neo-uvaria acuminatissima, commonly known as the slender-stemmed uvaria, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
